name: Javier Hernández Balcázar
politicalViews: Hernández is largely non-political except for his work with Mexican children via the United Nations.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.sourceTitle: Javier Hernandez a Muslim or Catholic
content.text: He is even known for his ritual pre-game prayers, in which, in front of a crowd of thousands, Hernández will kneel down on the field, hold his hands at chest level, and chant a prayer.

content.sourceTitle: Fergie set to advise Javier Hernandez to ditch his pre-match Catholic prayer at Ibrox
content.text: This usually isn't a problem. But when Hernández' team plays the Glasgow, Scotland Rangers–a team known for its anti-Catholic sentiment and roots in the Anglican tradition–Hernández is asked to avoid his prayers for the sake of peace.

But Hernández isn't fazed, and is known to be a grounded, spiritual and dedicated person and player who doesn't participate in his teammates' late night parties and has been with the same girlfriend for years. His grandfather said of Hernández:
He has his diet — he doesn't eat just anything. He never drinks even a drop of alcohol. He doesn't stay up late for any reason.
Sounds like he's a bit of a goody-two-shoes.

Footballers are international entities, bounced around the world from football club to football club, country to country, city to city. And clearly, Hernández holds a special place in his heart for his home country of Mexico. As an international figure, his quasi-political activities have been for the benefit of Mexico through an international organization–the United Nations.

content.sourceTitle: Futbol player Chicharito partners with UNICEF Mexico
content.text: Hernández is a UNICEF ambassador in Mexico, charged with promoting, encouraging and helping to bring a better life to Mexican children through education, nutrition, and protection from diseases and social problems.
This could easily be viewed as charitable/philanthropic activities rather then political activities.
I can't find anything about direct political statements or involvement from Hernández. Maybe if I knew Spanish, I could. Any Hernández fans out there that know anything, let us know in the comments.
